FormCharacteristics.flowing: Smooth, continuous strokes with a sense of ease
FormCharacteristics.somewhatFlowing: Generally smooth with occasional breaks or stiffness
FormCharacteristics.jagged: Abrupt, sharp, and uneven strokes, lacking smoothness
FormCharacteristics.somewhatJagged: Primarily sharp but with occasional smoother sections
FormCharacteristics.elegant: Graceful, refined, and polished with a delicate appearance
FormCharacteristics.somewhatElegant: Mostly refined but with occasional rough patches
FormCharacteristics.blocky: Square and rigid, with strong, box-like shapes
FormCharacteristics.partiallyBlocky: Primarily blocky with some curves or smoother elements
FormCharacteristics.spidery: Thin, delicate, and web-like with a fragile appearance
FormCharacteristics.childlike: Simple, immature, and lacking refinement or structure
FormCharacteristics.sharp: Crisp and pointed with clear, distinct edges
FormCharacteristics.somewhatMessy: Mostly tidy but with occasional messiness or irregularities
FormCharacteristics.messy: Disorganized and difficult to decipher, with irregular form

Shape.angularLetters: Letters formed with sharp, distinct angles
Shape.somewhatAngular: Primarily angular, with occasional rounded or soft edges
Shape.roundedLetters: Smooth, curved, and soft letters with no sharp angles
Shape.somewhatRounded: Generally curved but with some angular forms

LetterSize.large: Big, oversized letters with strong presence on the page
LetterSize.slightlyLarge: Larger than average but not overly big
LetterSize.slightlySmall: Slightly smaller than average but still legible
LetterSize.small: Compact, minimal letters that are smaller than typical
LetterSize.inconsistent: Varies in size throughout the text, with noticeable shifts

Slant.extremeForward: Very strong slant to the right, indicating assertiveness or urgency
Slant.forward: Noticeable slant to the right but not extreme
Slant.upright: Perfectly vertical, with no slant in either direction
Slant.backward: Moderate slant to the left, indicating hesitation or conservativeness
Slant.extremeBackward: Very strong slant to the left, reflecting strong restraint or withdrawal

LetterSpacing.compressed: Letters are very close together, almost touching
LetterSpacing.quiteCompressed: Letters are fairly close together with minimal space
LetterSpacing.slightlyCompressed: Letters are somewhat close but still readable
LetterSpacing.quiteExpansive: Letters are generously spaced but not overly wide
LetterSpacing.expansive: Letters are spaced well apart with visible gaps
LetterSpacing.extremelyExpansive: Letters are very widely spaced, almost disconnected

WordSpacing.wideWordSpacing: Large gaps between words, indicating clear separation
WordSpacing.moderatelyWideWordSpacing: Words are well-spaced but still connected
WordSpacing.slightlyWideWordSpacing: Words are slightly more spaced than typical
WordSpacing.narrowWordSpacing: Words are close together with minimal gaps
WordSpacing.extremelyNarrowWordSpacing: Words are almost touching or overlapping

LetterConnectivity.connectedWriting: Letters are joined together with flowing, continuous strokes
LetterConnectivity.mostlyConnectedWriting: Letters are mostly joined, but occasional breaks occur
LetterConnectivity.mostlyDisconnectedWriting: Letters are mostly separated and stand apart from one another, occasional joins
LetterConnectivity.disconnectedWriting: Letters are separated and stand apart from one another

LoopStyle.looped: Letters like 'l' and 'e' have clear, defined loops
LoopStyle.somewhatLooped: Loops are present but not always fully formed

LoopClosure.closedLoops: Loops are fully closed, creating complete circular shapes
LoopClosure.partiallyClosedLoops: Loops are mostly closed but with small openings
LoopClosure.openLoops: Loops are open, incomplete, or barely formed

BottomStrokes.felonsClaw: Sharp, hook-like shapes at the bottom of letters, resembling claws
BottomStrokes.minimal: Just a simple straight ish line down

Baseline.straight: Writing follows a straight and even baseline with no deviation
Baseline.mostlyStraight: Generally straight but with small fluctuations
Baseline.ascending: Writing moves upwards, rising above the baseline gradually
Baseline.slightlyAscending: Slight upward trend but not extreme
Baseline.descending: Writing slopes downwards, below the baseline
Baseline.wavy: Baseline undulates with noticeable rises and falls

TopZone.Normal: Normal sized, consistent with other zones

MidZone.Normal: Normal sized, consistent with other zones

BottomZone.Normal: Normal sized, consistent with other zones
